<Text: The International Fisheries Exhibition was a Victorian era scientific, cultural, and animal exhibition open in South Kensington, London, United Kingdom, between May 12 and October 31, 1883.>

<Text: International Fisheries Exhibition:  One of many world's fairs that took place in the second half of the 19th century, the exhibition was the largest special event held in the world to that point, attracting 2.6 million visitors, an average of 18,545 per day.>
